meanings.definition: To plant too many plants in an area.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overplant my garden every spring, and it becomes overcrowded.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overplant the flower bed to allow each plant enough space to grow.
meanings.sent3: My neighbor tends to overplant her yard, and it looks like a jungle!
meanings.sent4: The small backyard was overplanted with so many flowers that it resembled a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent5: Overplanting can lead to plants competing for sunlight and nutrients, causing them to wither.

meanings.definition: To plant more than is necessary or advisable.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overplant my pots with too many seeds, resulting in overcrowding.
meanings.sent2: It is better to underplant than to overplant and risk the plants not thriving.
meanings.sent3: My friend always jokes that I overplant my garden because I love seeing it full.
meanings.sent4: She decided to overplant the field with corn, hoping for a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: Overplanting can lead to wasted resources and effort if the plants do not survive.

meanings.definition: To cover or fill with too many plants.
meanings.sent1: The landscaper tends to overplant the flower beds, creating a dense and lush look.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to overplant a small area, thinking more plants will make it look better.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like a forest because the gardener would always overplant.
meanings.sent4: The balcony was overplanted with so many pots that there was hardly any space left.
meanings.sent5: Overplanting can make a space feel cramped and overwhelming with greenery.
